review.title: Representing, Simulating and Analysing Ho Chi Minh City Tsunami Plan by Means of Process Models
review.abstract: This paper considers the textual guidelines proposed by People's Committee of Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam to manage earthquake, tsunami and try to represent it in a more formal way in order to provide means to simulate, analyse and adapt it. After a state of the art about the coordination models and their possible applications to disaster management, we give an overview of the tsunami plan of Ho Chi Minh City and then its graphical representation with BPMN (Business Process Model and Notation). We then show how to exploit it with workflow tools to simulate (YAWL language) and analyse it (PROM tool)

sections.heading: A. Actors and Tasks
sections.text: During the response and rescue phase, the following 7 actors are involved: • A1: Institute of Geophysics (Vietnam Academy of Science and Technology) • A2: Local Administration • A3: Military • A4: Police • A5: Local Civil Defense • A6: Communication Unit • A7: Health and Red Cross Organizations Each actor has many tasks. In Table I, we list only the most important tasks for each actor. In the next subsection, we describe the sequence of a typical situation to respond to a tsunami.

sections.heading: B. Processes
sections.text: When identifying the risk of a tsunami (T1) affecting Ho Chi Minh City, the Institute of Geophysics (A1) will inform the city's local administration (A2) of the time, location and predictive level of the tsunami so that it can be prepared to respond. Once this warning (T3) has been lifted, the local administration (A2) will inform the local administration (T5) of the tsunami risk for the city's functional units such as: military (A3), police (A4), local civil protection forces (A5), communications unit (A6), health and Red Cross organisation (A7),... so that they can initiate and coordinate their own activities. At the same time, the local administration (A2) fires the torches (T4) to warn people. The local civil protection forces (A5) use portable loudspeakers (T6) to notify the city's residents and residents.

metadata.abstractText: This paper considers the textual plan (guidelines) proposed by People’s Committee of Ho Chi Minh City (Vietnam) to manage earthquake and tsunami, and try to represent it in a more formal way, in order to provide means to simulate, analyse and adapt it. We first present a state of the art about coordination models for disaster management with a focus on process oriented approaches. We give an overview of the different dimensions of the textual tsunami plan of Ho Chi Minh City and then the graphical representation of its process with BPMN (Business Process Model and Notation). We finally show how to exploit this process with workflow tools to simulate (YAWL tool) and analyse it (PROM tool).
